quiz.question: Who declared "Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!" in 1987?
Who wrote "The only thing we have to fear is fear itself" in his inaugural address?
Who penned "The Revolution is not an apple that falls when it is ripe" about revolutionary timing?
Who exclaimed "Surrender? I will never surrender" and led his country in WWII?
Who famously wrote "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing"?
Which Japanese daimyo reportedly said "Rule the Empire by force of arms" during Sengoku unification?
Who uttered "That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind"?
Who wrote "Let them eat cake" is a famous phrase linked to which royal figure?
Who declared "My only loyalty is to my country" facing treason charges in early modern Europe?
Who said "I am the state" often associated with absolute monarchy?
Which Italian explorer said his voyages proved the New World was not Asia?
Who wrote "The East is a career for the young" advising imperial officers within colonial service?
Who said "The buck stops here" as a symbol of presidential responsibility?
Who wrote "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies but the silence of our friends"?
Who wrote "I fear all we have done is to awaken a sleeping giant" about Pacific conflict consequences?
